questions.question: What is a field trip?

options.text: Visit to study geographical features directly

questions.answer: Visit to study geographical features directly

questions.question: Why are field trips important in geography?
questions.answer: For direct observation and learning

questions.question: Which skill is developed through field trips?
questions.answer: Observation

questions.question: Which instrument is commonly used during a field trip?
questions.answer: Compass

questions.question: Field trips help students to understand ____.
questions.answer: Real life geographical features

questions.question: Which of the following is a field trip location?
questions.answer: River basin

questions.question: What should be done before a field trip?
questions.answer: Proper planning

questions.question: Which is an objective of field trip?
questions.answer: Practical knowledge

questions.question: Who guides students during a field trip?
questions.answer: Teacher

questions.question: Field trips promote ____.
questions.answer: Experiential learning

questions.question: What is a field trip?
questions.answer: A field trip is an educational visit to observe and study geographical features directly.

questions.question: Why are field trips useful?
questions.answer: They provide practical knowledge and real-life understanding of geography.

questions.question: Name two objectives of a field trip.
questions.answer: Observation of features and collection of information.

questions.question: What preparations are needed before a field trip?
questions.answer: Planning, permission, route map and safety instructions are needed.

questions.question: What is the role of a teacher during a field trip?
questions.answer: To guide, instruct and ensure safety of students.
